intro: Lindera umbellata var. umbellata, commonly known as sweet pepper bush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers in late spring, followed by orange to red, berry-like fruits. Its leaves and fruits contain essential oils, contributing to its aromatic properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
